snow¶

(thermal_history.core_models.leeds.routines.snow)

Cl_calc(phi, L, T, conc_l, dmu_dc, snow_index)[source]¶

Returns the Cl factor which normalises changes in slurry mass fraction to changes in temperature.

Parameters:

  • phi (array) – solid fraction

  • L (array) – Latent heat

  • T (array) – Temperature

  • conc_l (array) – mass fraction of alloying light element

  • dmu_dc (arraty) – change in chemical potential with mass fraction

  • snow_index (int) – Index from which snow zone starts in arrays

Returns:

Cl factor

Return type:

array

Cp_factor(r, rho, Cl, Ta, M_liquid, snow_index)[source]¶

Calculates factor relating changes in mass fraction of the liquid region to those of the slurry

Parameters:

  • r (array) – Radius

  • rho (array) – Density

  • Cl (array) – Cl factor relating slurry mass fraction changes to temperature

  • Ta (array) – Adiabatic temperature

  • M_liquid (float) – Mass of the liquid region

  • snow_index (int) – Index from which snow zone starts in arrays

Returns:

Cp factor

Return type:

float

check_top_down_freezing(r, T, Tm)[source]¶

Checks for top-down freezing regime

Parameters:

  • r (array) – radius

  • T (array) – Temperature

  • Tm (array) – Melting temperature

gravitational_freezing(r, rho, psi, alpha_c, Cl, Ta, snow_index)[source]¶

Calculates the gravitational energy/entropy associated with reducing density of snow zone.

Parameters:

  • r (array) – Radius

  • rho (array) – Density

  • psi (array) – Gravitational potential

  • alpha_c (float) – Chemical expansivity

  • Cl (array) – Cl factor relating slurry mass fraction changes to temperature

  • Ta (array) – Adiabatic temperature

  • snow_index (int) – Index from which snow zone starts in arrays

Returns:

Normalised energy/entropy

Return type:

(float, float)

gravitational_melting(r, rho, psi, alpha_c, Cp, Cc, Cr, Tcmb, snow_index)[source]¶

Calculates the gravitational energy/entropy associated with increasing density of liquid region

Parameters:

  • r (array) – Radius

  • rho (array) – Density

  • psi (array) – Gravitational potential

  • alpha_c (float) – Chemical expansivity

  • Cp (float) – Cp factor relating changes in mass fraction of the liquid region to those of the slurry

  • Cc (float) – Cc factor relating changes in snow zone radius to changes in mass fraction of the liquid

  • Cr (float) – Cr factor relating changes in snow zone radius to changes in temperature

  • Ta (array) – Adiabatic temperature

  • snow_index (int) – Index from which snow zone starts in arrays

Returns:

Normalised energy/entropy

Return type:

(float, float)

latent_snow(r, rho, L, Cl, conc_l_profile, Ta, snow_index)[source]¶

Returns the normalised rate of latent heat release from changes in mass fraction throughout the slurry.

Parameters:

  • r (array) – Radius

  • rho (array) – Density

  • L (array) – Latent heat

  • Cl (array) – Cl factor relating slurry mass fraction changes to temperature

  • conc_l_profile (array) – Light element concentration profile

  • Ta (array) – Adiabatic temperature

  • snow_index (int) – Index from which snow zone starts in arrays

Returns:

Normalised energy and entropy release

Return type:

(float, float)

snow_composition(Ta, Tm_fe, initial_conc, snow_index, conc_l, P, melting_params)[source]¶

Calculates the composition of the slurry such that the melting temperature is elevated to the adiabatic temperature. The Williams and Nimmo (2004) parameterisation for the melting curve is assumed: Tm = Tm_fe*(1-conc_l+initial_conc)

Parameters:

  • Ta (array) – Adiabatic temperature (array)

  • Tm_fe (array) – Melting temperature of pure iron (array)

  • intial_conc (float) – Initial concentration of liquid

  • snow_index (int) – Index from which snow zone starts in arrays

  • melting_params (array) – Array of melting temperature parameters

Returns:

Radial concentration profile in snow zone

Return type:

array

snow_radius(r, T, Tm)[source]¶

Finds the snow zone radius by intersection of the temperature with the melting curve.

Parameters:

  • r (array) – Radius

  • T (array) – Temperature

  • Tm (array) – Melting temperature

Returns:

Snow zone radius

Return type:

float
